body:
Thanks! [The example](https://github.com/eslint/eslint/blob/1866e1df6175e4ba0ae4a0d88dc3c956bb310035/docs/src/use/configure/configuration-files-new.md?plain=1#L469-L486) is misleading because it's exporting what is currently a eslintrc-style config (`jsdoc.configs.recommended`) in a flat config array, which is not supported. This has been already noticed and is being discussed in #17355.

The thrown `TypeError` message seems unclear: if the rest of the team agrees, we could think about ways to improve it.
Yes, exactly. This is something that will happen a lot when people switch over to flat config

I wouldn't say the message is useless, it lets you know that there's an invalid value in the `plugins` key. Finding the key is an issue because it is obscured as a reference.

Suggestions for how to improve the message are definitely welcome, I'm just not sure what kind of message would clearly tell you that `jsdoc.configs.recommended` is the problem here.
Maybe the line number of where jsdoc.configs.recommended is used, so there is at least some starting point? Not sure if that's possible though

> Maybe the line number of where jsdoc.configs.recommended is used, so there is at least some starting point? Not sure if that's possible though

@kkmuffme we don't have that information. All ESLint gets is an array of objects.

> It would be helpful to know if the schema violation is from a plugin incompatibility with the new flat config or not, rather than user error, and therefore out of their hands.

@morganney I assume by "plugin compatibility" you mean if they're using the wrong config format? All plugins are, by default, compatible with flat config. It's the shareable configs that have compatibility issues.

In the case of the original comment, the error message is because eslintrc defines `plugins` as an array of strings whereas flat config defines `plugins` as an object.
---
After looking into this a bit, I think we can make a few changes to at least guess if someone is using eslintrc where they shouldn't be and explicitly mention that in the error message. We're never going to get to a point where we can point to the line in the config file that's causing the problem but maybe some more context would help.

issue.title: feat: Improve config error messages

repository.name: eslint
repository.description: Find and fix problems in your JavaScript code.

issue.body:
<!--
    Thank you for contributing!

    ESLint adheres to the [JS Foundation Code of Conduct](https://eslint.org/conduct).
-->

#### Prerequisites checklist

- [x] I have read the [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/eslint/eslint/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md).

#### What is the purpose of this pull request? (put an "X" next to an item)

<!--
    The following template is intentionally not a markdown checkbox list for the reasons
    explained in https://github.com/eslint/eslint/pull/12848#issuecomment-580302888
-->

[ ] Documentation update
[ ] Bug fix ([template](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eslint/eslint/HEAD/templates/bug-report.md))
[ ] New rule ([template](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eslint/eslint/HEAD/templates/rule-proposal.md))
[ ] Changes an existing rule ([template](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eslint/eslint/HEAD/templates/rule-change-proposal.md))
[ ] Add autofix to a rule
[ ] Add a CLI option
[x] Add something to the core
[ ] Other, please explain:

<!--
    If the item you've checked above has a template, please paste the template questions below and answer them. (If this pull request is addressing an issue, you can just paste a link to the issue here instead.)
-->

<!--
    Please ensure your pull request is ready:

    - Read the pull request guide (https://eslint.org/docs/latest/contribute/pull-requests)
    - Include tests for this change
    - Update documentation for this change (if appropriate)
-->

<!--
    The following is required for all pull requests:
-->

#### What changes did you make? (Give an overview)

Includes some keys to catch known eslintrc keys when they appear in flat config. This throws a specific error that the ESLint CLI can then output a more helpful message about.

refs #17370

#### Is there anything you'd like reviewers to focus on?

Did I miss any top-level keys?

(Note: we can probably do more to do things like catch the different in `plugins` format, just wanted to get the ball rolling.)

<!-- markdownlint-disable-file MD004 -->
